sections.heading: What is 〜みたい (mitai)?
sections.content:
〜みたい is a casual way to express similarity or conjecture, meaning "like," "similar to," or "it seems/looks like." It's the casual equivalent of ようだ.

雨が降るみたい "It looks like it will rain" 彼は学生みたい "He seems like a student / He's like a student"

children.heading: With Verbs (Plain Form)
children.content: 降る → 降るみたい "looks like it will rain" 降った → 降ったみたい "looks like it rained" 降らない → 降らないみたい "looks like it won't rain"

children.heading: With I-adjectives
children.content: 高い → 高いみたい "seems expensive" 高かった → 高かったみたい "seems it was expensive" 高くない → 高くないみたい "seems it's not expensive"

children.heading: With Na-adjectives and Nouns
children.content:
Add みたい directly (no だ):

便利 → 便利みたい "seems convenient" 学生 → 学生みたい "seems like a student / like a student" 雨 → 雨みたい "looks like rain"

children.heading: 1. Similarity (like/similar to)
children.content: これは夢みたいだ "This is like a dream" 彼は子供みたいだ "He's like a child" 猫みたいな動物 "an animal like a cat"

children.heading: 2. Conjecture/Appearance (seems/looks like)
children.content: 雨が降るみたい "It looks like it will rain" 彼は忙しいみたい "He seems busy" 誰もいないみたい "It seems nobody's here"

sections.heading: Usage: Casual Form
sections.content:
みたい is casual. For polite speech, use ようです:

Casual: 雨が降るみたい Polite: 雨が降るようです "It looks like it will rain" Casual: 学生みたい Polite: 学生のようです "Seems like a student"

children.heading: みたい vs ようだ
children.content: みたい: Casual 雨が降るみたい "Looks like it will rain" ようだ: Formal 雨が降るようだ "It appears it will rain"

children.heading: みたい vs らしい vs そうだ
children.content: みたい: Personal observation/guess 雨が降るみたい (I sense/observe) "Looks like it will rain" らしい: Hearsay/inference 雨が降るらしい (I heard/gathered) "Apparently it will rain" そうだ: Heard directly 雨が降るそうだ (someone said) "I heard it will rain"

children.heading: Like/Similar to
children.content: 夢みたい "like a dream" 子供みたいな人 "a child-like person" 春みたいな天気 "spring-like weather" 映画みたいな話 "a story like a movie"

children.heading: Comparisons
children.content: 猫みたいな動物 "an animal like a cat" 彼は先生みたいだ "He's like a teacher"

children.heading: Based on Observation
children.content: 雨が降るみたい "Looks like it will rain" (I see clouds) 誰もいないみたい "It seems nobody's here" (it's quiet) 彼は忙しいみたい "He seems busy" (his behavior)

children.heading: 〜みたいだ (casual statement)
children.content: 雨が降るみたいだ "Looks like it will rain" 彼は学生みたいだ "He seems like a student"

children.heading: 〜みたいです (polite-ish)
children.content:
Still casual but slightly more polite:

雨が降るみたいです "Looks like it will rain" 彼は学生みたいです "He seems like a student"

children.heading: 〜みたいな + noun
children.content:
Modifying nouns:

夢みたいな話 "a dream-like story" 子供みたいな人 "a child-like person" 映画みたいな恋 "a movie-like romance"

children.heading: 〜みたいに (like/in the manner of)
children.content:
Adverb form:

猫みたいに静か "quiet like a cat" 子供みたいに笑う "laugh like a child" 映画みたいに話す "talk like in a movie"

children.heading: Example 1: Weather
children.content: A: 外、どう？ "How's it outside?" B: 雨が降るみたい "Looks like it will rain" A: じゃあ、傘を持って行こう "Then let's bring an umbrella"

children.heading: Example 2: Observation
children.content: A: 田中さん、いる？ "Is Tanaka here?" B: いないみたい。電気が消えてる "Doesn't seem like it. The lights are off" A: そっか "I see"

children.heading: Example 3: Similarity
children.content: A: この料理、おいしいね "This food is delicious" B: レストランのみたいだね "It's like restaurant food" A: プロみたいだよ "It's like a professional made it"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using だ with nouns/na-adjectives
children.content: Wrong: 学生だみたい ❌ Right: 学生みたい ✓ "Seems like a student" Wrong: 便利だみたい ❌ Right: 便利みたい ✓ "Seems convenient"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Confusing with observation そう
children.content: みたい: Inference from evidence 雨が降るみたい (clouds, wind) "Looks like it will rain" そう: Visual appearance 雨が降りそう (very dark clouds) "Looks like it will rain (imminent)"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using in formal situations
children.content: Too casual for formal: みたい Better for formal: ようです

children.heading: Conjecture
children.content: 来ないみたい "Seems he won't come" おいしくないみたい "Seems it's not delicious" 学生じゃないみたい "Seems he's not a student"

children.heading: Similarity
children.content: 夢みたいじゃない "It's not like a dream" 子供みたいじゃない "He's not like a child"

children.heading: 〜みたいなもの (something like)
children.content: 趣味みたいなもの "something like a hobby" 友達みたいなもの "something like a friend"

children.heading: 〜みたいなこと (something like)
children.content: そんなみたいなことを言った "Said something like that"

children.heading: What/Who is like
children.content: 誰みたい？ "Who does (he) look like?" 何みたい？ "What does it look like?" どこみたいな場所？ "What kind of place is it like?"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: 雨が降るみたい "Looks like it will rain" 学生みたい "Seems like a student"

children.heading: Polite (still casual base)
children.content: 雨が降るみたいです "Looks like it will rain" 学生みたいです "Seems like a student"

children.heading: Formal (use ようです instead)
children.content: 雨が降るようです "It appears it will rain" 学生のようです "Appears to be a student"

children.heading: Dreams and Fantasy
children.content: 夢みたい "like a dream" 映画みたいな "like a movie" おとぎ話みたい "like a fairy tale"

children.heading: People Comparisons
children.content: 子供みたい "like a child" 大人みたい "like an adult" プロみたい "like a professional"

children.heading: Nature and Seasons
children.content: 春みたいな天気 "spring-like weather" 夏みたいに暑い "hot like summer"

children.heading: Visual Cues
children.content: 誰もいないみたい (quiet, dark) "Seems nobody's here" 閉まっているみたい (doors locked) "Seems it's closed"

children.heading: Behavioral Cues
children.content: 彼は忙しいみたい (rushing around) "He seems busy" 疲れているみたい (yawning) "Seems tired"

children.heading: Conjecture
children.content: 雨が降るみたい "Looks like it will rain" 彼は来ないみたい "Seems he won't come" 誰もいないみたい "Seems nobody's here" おいしいみたいですね "It looks delicious, doesn't it"

children.heading: Similarity
children.content: 夢みたいな話 "A dream-like story" 子供みたいな人 "A child-like person" 映画みたいだね "It's like a movie" 春みたいな天気 "Spring-like weather"

children.heading: Past Conjecture
children.content: 雨が降ったみたい "Looks like it rained" 彼は帰ったみたい "Seems he went home" 終わったみたいだ "Seems it ended"

children.heading: Negative
children.content: 来ないみたい "Seems he won't come" おいしくないみたい "Seems it's not delicious" 学生じゃないみたい "Seems he's not a student"

children.heading: With みたいに
children.content: 猫みたいに静か "Quiet like a cat" 子供みたいに遊ぶ "Play like a child" プロみたいに上手 "Skilled like a pro"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜ようだ (you da) - It appears/seems (formal) 〜そう (sou) - Looks like (observation) 〜らしい (rashii) - Apparently/seems 〜っぽい (ppoi) - Seems like/tends to Casual Speech Patterns - Informal Japanese Comparison expressions - Similar patterns
